articles.title: Smith College controversy highlights struggles schools face in making racially equitable campuses
articles.description: In the summer of 2018, Oumou Kanoute read a book and ate her lunch in a common room area of a residence hall that required keycard access at Smith College. Since she was in a program teaching high school students over the summer, she was able to access it.

articles.title: Biden releases statement on pulling Tanden nomination
articles.description: The White House is pulling Neera Tanden's nomination to lead the Office of Management and Budget after key senators said they would vote against confirmation over her past tweets.

articles.author: Ryan Nobles and Lauren Fox, CNN
articles.title: Pelosi's office says 2 controversial projects will be pulled from Covid bill
articles.description: Two big projects originally slated to be part of the Covid-19 relief bill but criticized as being unrelated to coronavirus relief will be pulled from the package, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's office confirmed to CNN on Tuesday.

articles.title: The Trumps are back, playing victims again

articles.title: Rural Americans in pharmacy deserts hurting for Covid-19 vaccines
articles.description: As the Biden administration accelerates a plan to use pharmacies to distribute Covid-19 vaccines, significant areas of the country lack brick-and-mortar pharmacies capable of administering the protective shots.

articles.title: Anderson Cooper reads to his son Wyatt
articles.description: Anderson Cooper celebrated "Read Across America Day" by reading to his son Wyatt. Watch "Full Circle" on Monday, Tuesday and Friday at 6p E.T.

articles.author: Phil Mattingly and Kate Sullivan, CNN
articles.title: White House pulls Tanden nomination
articles.description: The White House is pulling the nomination of Neera Tanden to lead the Office of Management and Budget, according to an administration official.

articles.author: Analysis by Chris Cillizza, CNN Editor-at-large
articles.title: This GOP governor has it all wrong on Covid-19
articles.description: To listen to South Dakota Republican Gov. Kristi Noem's speech over the weekend at the Conservative Political Action Conference was to hear a success story of massive proportions when it comes to the fight against Covid-19.
articles.content:
THE POINT -- NOW ON YOUTUBE! 
In each episode of his weekly YouTube show, Chris Cillizza will delve a little deeper into the surreal world of politics. Click to subscribe!

articles.author: Jen Christensen, CNN
articles.title: 'The impossible is not impossible': The push to make Covid-19 vaccines at record speed
articles.description: Before the vaccine can ever get into someone's arm, it must go through a sophisticated and complicated process that involves several companies. It can't happen overnight, but companies say vaccine manufacturing has moved at a speed that has never been seen be…
articles.content: CNN's Kevin Liptak, Jeff Zeleny and John Harwood contributed to this report.

articles.author: Joan Biskupic, CNN legal analyst & Supreme Court biographer
articles.title: John Roberts has another chance to diminish the Voting Rights Act
articles.description: Chief Justice John Roberts has singlehandedly slowed a conservative revolution at the Supreme Court in recent years, but he has for even longer -- 40 years -- opposed racial remedies and narrowly construed the landmark Voting Rights Act.

articles.author: Omar Jimenez, CNN
articles.title: Some Chicago children return to classroom for the first time in almost a year
articles.description: This week marked a milestone for students and teachers in the Chicago Public Schools. The nation's third largest school district welcomed back thousands of kindergarten through 5th grade students on Monday, and middle schoolers may return next week.
articles.content:
Chicago (CNN)Leigh Oquendo welcomed her kindergarteners on Monday as they filed into her Hawthorne Scholastic Academy classroom in Chicago, as any teacher would.

articles.title: What's happening in Texas and Mississippi has to stop
articles.description: Peniel Joseph says the winter storm aftermath in Texas and Mississippi that has disproportionately hit Black and Latinx communities and left many still without access to clean water is one facet of a decades-long national crisis of race and democracy.

articles.title: Dolly Parton has received her first dose of the Covid-19 vaccine
articles.description: Dolly Parton is showing everyone how it's done by receiving her first Covid-19 vaccination shot.

articles.title: Watch FBI director debunk conspiracy theories pushed by Trump supporters
articles.description: CNN's Jessica Schneider reports on FBI Director Christopher Wray's testimony to the Senate committee investigating the security failures that took place during the January 6th Capitol riot.

articles.author: Holly Johnson
articles.title: How does guaranteed life insurance work?
articles.description: Guaranteed life insurance is ideal for seniors and people who have existing health issues since you can't be turned down for it, but there are downsides to this type of policy as well.
articles.content: Buying life insurance is easiest when youre young and healthy, since the best rates and policy terms go to those who pose the least amount of risk to an insurer. But not everyone gets enough life ins… [+6067 chars]

articles.title: See Biden's major announcement on vaccines
articles.description: President Joe Biden announced the US will have enough Covid-19 vaccine doses for every US adult by the end of May, accelerating the timeline by two months.

articles.author: Lauren M. Johnson, CNN
articles.title: Tennessee is hoping to make Dolly Parton's 'Amazing Grace' an official state song
articles.description: A bill in the Tennessee Legislature would officially make Dolly Parton's version of "Amazing Grace" the state hymn, adding to its 10 state songs.

articles.author: Shirin Ali, CNN
articles.title: Will Smith says he might step into politics one day
articles.description: Actor Will Smith teased the idea of running for political office one day during an interview on Pod Save America released on Monday, a politics podcast hosted by a group of aides to former President Barack Obama.

articles.author: Pete Muntean and Greg Wallace
articles.title: Johnson & Johnson Covid-19 vaccine given to first patients in Ohio
articles.description: The long-awaited, one-dose Johnson & Johnson Covid-19 vaccine has now been administered in the United States.

articles.author: Ramishah Maruf, CNN Business
articles.title: Reese's is launching a peanut butter cup without any chocolate
articles.description: For the first time in company history, Reese's is launching a peanut butter cup with no chocolate.

articles.author: Richard Roth and Caitlin Hu, CNN
articles.title: A fight has erupted over Myanmar's seat at the United Nations
articles.description: Kyaw Moe Tun says he represents Myanmar's civilian government led by Aung San Suu Kyi, which was overthrown last month in a military coup. Suu Kyi has now been detained alongside other government leaders including President Win Myint.

articles.author: Clare Duffy, CNN Business
articles.title: Square launches an in-house bank as fintech competition heats up
articles.description: Square, the financial payments firm run by Jack Dorsey, launched an in-house bank that it says will allow it to "operate more nimbly" in an increasingly crowded fintech market.

articles.author: Peter Valdes-Dapena, CNN Business
articles.title: Volkswagen and GM take on Tesla with new compact electric SUVs
articles.description: After years of saying it would happen, major automakers are finally coming out with more affordable electric vehicles for regular people.
